question: Will Shiba Inu ($SHIB) reach market cap of $50 billion at any point on or before November 15th?
description:
In Response to Trader Inquiry: Note that this market pertains to the timeframe between the date of market inception, October 28, 2021, and the resolution date, November 15, 2021. 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the market cap of Shiba Inu (SHIB) reaches $50,000,000,000.00 as per CoinMarketCap (https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/shiba-inu/) at any point on or before the resolution time, and “No” otherwise. Market cap data from the graph on CoinMarketCap will be used as well as data under "SHIB Price Statistics."

The resolution time is November 15, 2021 at 11:59:59 PM ET.

question: Will Bitcoin ($BTC) price reach $70,000 before November 15, 2021?
description:
This is a market on whether the USD price of Bitcoin ($BTC) will reach $70,000 at any point at or before 11:59:59 PM ET, November 14, 2021. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" whenever the USD price of $BTC is at or above $70,000.00 according to Coingecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin), and if that condition is not met by the resolution date, it will resolve to "No".

question: Will the Air Quality Index in Los Angeles be 60 or higher on November 1st?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes”, if the AQI in Central Los Angeles for November 1st is equal or higher than 60, and “No” otherwise. 

The resolution source will be AirNow - U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's project, measuring and reporting Air Quality Index, 
https://www.airnow.gov/?city=Los%20Angeles&state=CA&country=USA. The data used is by clicking “Recent Trends”, and hovering over Nov 1st under the bar chart titled “Week” at the check time. 

The check time will be at 12:00 PM ET, November 2.

question: Will it be sunny in Washington DC at noon on November 3rd?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes”, if the level of solar radiation as measured by The Washington Post weather station on November 3rd at 11:59 AM ET is equal to or higher than 500 (watts/m²) and ""No"" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market is https://www.wunderground.com/dashboard/pws/KDCWASHI185/table/2021-11-03/2021-11-03/daily, under the table column titled “Solar” for the day of November 3, 2021. Data recorded for 11:59 AM ET will be used to resolve the market. 

The check will be at 3:00 PM ET, November 3.

question: Will the Raptors beat the Magic by more than 8.5 points in their October 29th matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game:

If the Toronto Raptors win by over 8.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Orlando Magic lose by less than 8.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by November 5, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will year-to-year inflation in the European Union be 4.3% or more in October?
description:
This is a market on a year-to-year inflation, as measured by the Eurostat (HICP), from October 2020 to October 2021.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the European Union annual inflation in October 2021 is 4.3 percent or more and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/products-euro-indicators.

The next release of HICP inflation rate with full data for October 2021 is scheduled for 17 November 2021.

-----------------------------------

In the euro area, the Harmonised Index of Consumer Prices (HICP) is used to measure consumer price inflation. That means the change over time in the prices of consumer goods and services purchased by euro area households. It is “harmonised” because all the countries in the European Union follow the same methodology. This ensures that the data for one country can be compared with the data for another.

Note that this market is about the inflation for all European Union Member States, not only the Euro zone (states using €).

Inflation dashboard for the Euro zone can be viewed here: https://www.ecb.europa.eu/stats/macroeconomic_and_sectoral/hicp/html/index.en.html

question: Will there be 750,000 or more total ETH burned before November 4th, 2021?
description:
This is a market on the amount of ETH that will be burned from when EIP-1559 was implemented to the market's resolution time, November 3, 11:59 PM ET. 

The resolution source for this market will be https://etherchain.org/burn, under “Total burned.” 

If the number of "Total burned" equals to or is greater than 750,000.0 ETH on the resolution time, this market resolves to "Yes", and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source will be checked at exactly November 3, 2021, 11:59 PM ET. If data is not available on the webpage at that time, another credible source will be chosen.

question: Will the high temperature in New York's Central Park be 60°F or higher on November 2, 2021?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes”, if the maximum air temperature measured on November 2nd by the National Weather Service in Central Park Area, NY, is 60°F or higher, and ""No"" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market is NOWdata, published by National Weather Service, published on their website: https://www.weather.gov/wrh/Climate?wfo=okx.

The check will be at 12:00 PM ET November 3.
